'''Finneon''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese:]] '''ケイコウオ''' ''Keikouo'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Lumineon}} starting at [[level]] 31.

==Biology==
Finneon is a small fish Pokémon with an ellipsoid body. The bottom half of its body is light-blue while the top half is black. A purple stripe runs across Finneon's horizontal length. This stripe can store sunlight, which allows Finneon to shine vividly at night. It has small blue pectoral fins, two black oval-shaped dorsal fins and purple eyes. Finneon's most notable feature is the pair of caudal fins that resemble a pair of blue butterfly wings with purple spots. Because of its wing-like fins, it is known as "The {{p|Beautifly}} of the Sea". The bottom lobes of a female Finneon's tail fin are bigger than a male's. It lives in bodies of water, and it travels in schools, sometimes with {{p|Lumineon}}. {{p|Wingull}} is a natural predator of Finneon.

==In the anime==
[[File:Finneon anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Finneon in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
[[Zoey]]'s Finneon debuted in ''[[DP077|Staging a Heroes' Welcome!]]'', where it was used in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the [[Wallace Cup]]. Finneon was revealed to have evolved into Lumineon by ''[[DP174|Last Call — First Round!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Finneon debuted in a brief cameo appearance in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]''.

A Finneon appeared in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

Multiple Finneon appeared in ''[[DP113|Hold the Phione!]]''.

A Finneon appeared in ''[[DP138|Strategy Begins at Home!]]''.

Multiple Finneon appeared in ''[[XY022|Going for the Gold!]]''.

Multiple Finneon appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]''.

Multiple Finneon appeared in ''[[SM002|The Guardian's Challenge!]]''.

A Finneon appeared in ''[[SM005|Yo, Ho, Ho! Go, Popplio!]]'', where {{an|Lana}} gave it some food after capturing it by fishing. It was later captured by {{TRT}}.

Multiple Finneon appeared in ''[[SM031|The Island Whisperer!]]''.

Multiple Finneon appeared in [[SM040]].

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Finneon's large tail fins are similar to the {{wp|freshwater butterflyfish}}, and they also resemble wings of actual {{wp|butterfly|butterflies}}. It also resembles a {{wp|neon tetra}} or a {{wp|cardinal tetra}}.

====Name origin====
Finneon is a combination of ''fin'' and ''neon''.

Keikouo is a combination of 蛍光 ''keikō'' (fluorescence) and 魚 ''uo'' (fish).
